p: Paeonia suffruticosa Andr. is a deciduous shrub in the Moutan section, genus Paeonia and family Ranunculaceae. It is a famous ornamental and aromatic plant native to China and is widely cultivated throughout the country. The plant grows up to 2 m tall and flowers during April and early May, emitting a pleasant floral aroma. The flowers are solitary in terminal and are 10–17 cm wide. The petals are single or double, in red, red-purple, pink or white colors. Meanwhile, petals are obovate 5–8 cm long and 4.2–6 cm wide, with the apex irregularly incised. This species has been cultivated for over 1000 years in China and there are now hundreds of cultivars within the country. Specifically, Luoyang (Henan Province) and Heze (Shandong Province) are two important places of cultivation [ 1].
